Summary Helping others, building great teams and solving impossible problems. That's what I'm passionate about and that's what makes me happy. 
 
Cyrus’ background in Information Technology starts in 2003 where he managed a systems integration and sales organization building servers, blades and enterprise hardware chassis. While working full-time he graduated Summa Cum Laude from UCLA in 2009, gaining his bachelors degree in International Development Studies. Cyrus later worked as an I.T. Consultant for BAE Systems and a Support Engineer for Verifi, an online payment processing gateway. 
 
He and his wife Stephanie joined the Peace Corps in 2010 serving as Youth Development Volunteers in Bulgaria where Cyrus taught Information Technology, Life Skills and English at orphanages and schools. After becoming pregnant with their first son Kameron, in 2011 Stephanie and Cyrus returned to the U.S. where Cyrus became a Production Support Engineer for SDL Language Weaver, supporting their cloud based statistical machine translation platform. 
 
Cyrus joined Experian Marketing Services in November 2012 as a member of Application Operations and Engineering. After his first year he was promoted to Manager of the team. Currently he serves as Senior Product Manager of Data Engineering and is responsible for massively scaling Experian's Marketing Suite of Products in terms of performance, reliability and quality. 
 
Cyrus is passionate about his family and about volunteering. He has served as Co-Executive Director of Standup For Kids – A non-profit dedicated to helping homeless youth and also Director of Volunteers for Hands on International, an organization that helps the homeless and families in need.

Summary Senior Technical Leader in the Nuclear Risk and Safety (RSM) program at the Electric Power Research Institute (EPRI). Research activities currently focus on developing Probabilistic Risk Assessment (PRA) Software. 
 
First joined EPRI in 1999 as a Resident Researcher from the French utility Electricité de France (EDF) working on the EDF Fire Modeling code MAGIC and its integration with EPRI’s PRA methodologies. In 2006 re-joined EPRI as an Applications Engineer where I supported the development, testing and user support for a wide range of EPRI software tools with a main emphasis on PRA codes. I assumed the position of Project Manager in 2012 and Senior Technical Leader in 2015. In this role, I manage the EPRI Risk and Reliability Users’ Group, the EPRI Phoenix Users' Group and all related research in PRA Software development. Functions include frequent on-site PRA software training at aerospace and nuclear users’ sites. 
Additionally, I manage the development of guidelines for Internal Flooding Probabilistic Risk Assessment (IFPRA) and the associated pipe rupture frequencies estimate studies. 
 
Prior to joining EPRI, I was a Customer Support Manager and a Product Manager at Data Systems and Solutions (DS&S), LLC where I led the development and testing of DS&S and EPRI PRA software codes and managed the support and help desk for the suite of PRA software tools. In these roles I focused on the end-user experience with the software tools and the application of EPRI’s PRA software at users’ sites.  
 
Hold a Master’s degree in Mechanical Engineering and a post graduate diploma (D.E.A.) in Fluid Dynamics and Transfer with honors both from Ecole Centrale de Nantes.
